qas.question: During Which dynasty does Josef Kolmaš claim Tibet was considered an organic part of China?
Josef Kolmaš  states that Tibet became subject to what government?

context: Josef Kolmaš, a sinologist, Tibetologist, and Professor of Oriental Studies at the Academy of Sciences of the Czech Republic, writes that it was during <a0_0>the Qing dynasty<a0_0/> "that developments took place on the basis of which Tibet came to be considered an organic part of China, both practically and theoretically subject to <a1_0>the Chinese central government<a1_0/>." Yet he states that this was a radical change in regards to all previous eras of Sino-Tibetan relations.
